name: "Brady Bunch" - "The Brady Brides" Multiple Choice Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: The first three episodes of 'The Brady Brides' (1981) were intended to have been a TV-movie.  These episodes included updates on all the original nine Brady Bunch characters.  What job does mom, Carol Brady, now have?
questions.explanation:
Real estate agent.

	With the children gone, Carol got her real estate license, and converted the boy's old bedroom into her office.

questions.text: On 'The Brady Brides' we learn that which Brady child has gone on to become an architect like patriarch Mike Brady?
questions.explanation:
Jan Brady.

	Jan had previously shown a talent for painting.  No doubt this worked in her favor as she followed in her step-father's footsteps.

questions.text: After a long time steadily dating, Jan Brady is the first of the six Brady kids to become betrothed.  What is the name of her fiance?
questions.explanation:
Phillip Covington III.

	Phillip is a few years older than Jan and is a college science professor.  He was played by actor Ron Kuhlman.

questions.text: As fate would have it, after Jan Brady's engagement, Marcia Brady accidentally meets and falls in love with her own future husband within days.  What is his name?
questions.explanation:
Wally Logan.

	Wally is a spontaneous, live-in-the-moment type character who works as a salesman for a toy company.  He was played by actor Jerry Houser.

questions.text: All nine main Brady Bunch characters are featured in the first three episodes of 'The Brady Brides'.  How many of those nine characters are played by their original actors?
questions.explanation:
Nine.

	The "Brady Girls Get Married" episodes 1, 2 and 3 of 'The Brady Brides' would be the ONLY Brady-related production, after the cancellation of the original series, to feature all nine original actors.

questions.text: Jan Brady and Marcia Brady both decide to marry their respective fiances in a double wedding ceremony.  What disagreement do they have over the ceremony?
options: In Town or Out of Town
questions.explanation:
Traditional or Nontraditional.

	Jan and Phillip are very traditional and structured, whereas Wally and Marcia are very carefree and nontraditional.  This dynamic that would be the basis for conflict in the subsequent 7 remaining episodes of the 'Brady Brides'.

questions.text: On 'The Brady Brides', what occupation had Marcia Brady gone into since finishing her schooling?
questions.explanation:
Fashion designer.

	Marcia always had a flare for fashion.  Remember when she made-over shy duckling Molly Webber into the swan of Senior Banquet Night in the original "Brady Bunch"?!

questions.text: In order to save money, what do the two couples on 'The Brady Brides' decide to do shortly after their double wedding?
questions.correct: Buy and move into a house together
options: Take an oath not to have any children right away
The husbands would take on second jobs
Move in with Mike and Carol Brady
questions.explanation:
Buy and move into a house together.

	Jan and Marcia's mother Carol, shows them both a beautiful home.  They both love it but the only way they can afford it is to pool their money and both couples move in together.

questions.text: On 'The Brady Brides', besides Jan and Marcia, what two characters from the original 'Brady Bunch' series are featured frequently in the final seven episodes?
questions.explanation:
Alice and Carol.

	Ann B. Davis (Alice) was a regularly billed cast member of 'The Brady Brides', and Florence Henderson (Carol) appeared in 5 of the final 7 episodes as a Special Guest Star.

questions.text: In one episode of 'The Brady Brides', Jan and Marcia appear on a game show together.  What game show was it?
questions.explanation:
The Newlywed Game.

	Both Brady girls, along with their respective husbands, appear on "the Newlywed Game".  Real life "Newlywed Game host", Bob Eubanks, appears in the episode as himself.
